summary.p: This module requires the service of mod_proxy. It provides support for the tunnelling of web socket connections to a backend websockets server. The connection is automatically upgraded to a websocket connection:
Proxying requests to a websockets server like echo.websocket.org can be done using the ProxyPass directive:
Proxying both HTTP and websockets at the same time can be done by specifying the websockets ProxyPass directive before the HTTP directive:
Load balancing for multiple backends can be achieved using mod_proxy_balancer.

In fact the module can be used to upgrade to other protocols, you can set the upgrade parameter in the ProxyPass directive to allow the module to accept other protocol. NONE means you bypass the check for the header but still upgrade to WebSocket. ANY means that Upgrade will read in the request headers and use in the response Upgrade

directivesynopsis.name: ProxyWebsocketAsync
directivesynopsis.description: Instructs this module to try to create an asynchronous tunnel

usage.p: This directive instructs the server to try to create an asynchronous tunnel. If the current MPM does not support the necessary features, a synchronous tunnel is used.

note.title: Note
note.p: Async support is experimental and subject to change.

directivesynopsis.name: ProxyWebsocketIdleTimeout
directivesynopsis.description: Sets the maximum amount of time to wait for data on the websockets tunnel

usage.p: This directive imposes a maximum amount of time for the tunnel to be left open while idle. The timeout is considered in seconds by default, but it is possible to increase the time resolution to milliseconds adding the ms suffix.

directivesynopsis.name: ProxyWebsocketAsyncDelay
directivesynopsis.description: Sets the amount of time the tunnel waits synchronously for data

usage.p: If ProxyWebsocketAsync is enabled, this directive controls how long the server synchronously waits for more data. The timeout is considered in seconds by default, but it is possible to increase the time resolution to milliseconds adding the ms suffix.

note.title: Note
note.p: Async support is experimental and subject to change.
